query: How does the study of the 5 Hz quasi-periodic oscillation in GRS 1739-278 extend our understanding of low-frequency QPOs and motivate further research on their properties in black-hole candidates?

citation_function_classification.justification: The query asks how the specific study expands (extends) current knowledge of low-frequency QPOs and also why it encourages further investigation (motivation).
